overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a methodical approach to time-series forecasting with limited data (96 hourly points). The analyst identifies daily seasonality, considers multiple modeling techniques (SARIMA, Exponential Smoothing), but ultimately selects a simple averaging method due to data constraints. The process includes thorough data inspection, handling of negative values, and careful rounding while acknowledging limitations of short time series.
common_data_patterns: Presence of negative values and zeros
No explicit missing values in historical data
key_insights: Prioritizing simplicity (hourly averaging) over complex models due to limited 4-day dataset
Explicit handling of negative values during averaging and rounding
Rounding forecasts to 3 decimals using round-half-up method
Repeating averaged daily patterns for multi-day forecasts
Acknowledgment of data limitations for stable seasonal modeling
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with thorough evaluation of statistical methods, but reverts to simple heuristics due to data constraints. Includes multi-step validation of seasonality, outlier consideration, and rounding protocols.
